Name: Business Segment Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Business Segment. ID
Description: The code of each business segment.
XBRLGL: XBRL GL tracks hierarchy ID, hierarchy description, and hierarchy type, so it can track code NA, description N. America, and type global area using gl-cor:accountSubID, gl-cor:accountSubDescription, and gl-cor:accountSubType, respectively. Interrelations and hierarchies are captured by gl-cor:parentSubAccountType (What is the hierarchy type this unit rolls up to?).

Name: Business Segment Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Business Segment. Business Segment. Name
Description: The name of the business segment.
XBRLGL: See above; an unlimited number of units and structures are permitted.

Name: Segment Reference Level
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Business Segment. Segment Reference Level. Code
Description: The relative level of the segment with being the consolidated level and numbers increasing through lower levels of the organizational chart.
XBRLGL: The relationships between higher-level hierarchies are captured once per Business Segment.

Name: Organization Type Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Business Segment. Organization Type. Name
Description: Indicates the name of the organization type, for example, Department and Cost Center.

Name: Parent Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Business Segment Hierarchy. Parent. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: The code of the parent business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

Name: Child Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Business Segment Hierarchy. Child. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: The code of the child business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

Name: Employee ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. ID
Description: The unique identifier for an employee. Typically auto-generated by the system.

Name: Employee Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Code
Description: The code of the employee. Each employee has only one code. If someone does part-time jobs in multiple departments, there will be more than one record with different Employee_ID in this table. And the part-time status will be reflected in Employee_Type_Code.

Name: Employee Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Name
Description: The name of the employee.

Name: Inactive flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Inactive Flag. Indicator
Description: Indicate whether one employee is active or inactive. One employee may become inactive due to some reasons such as sabbatical.

Name: Employee Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Type Code
Description: The code of the employee types. EXAMPLE Using 004 to represent an on-the-job employee, 005 to represent a retired employee, 006 to represent a deceased employee, and 007 to represent a part-time employee.

Name: Employee Type Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Type Name
Description: The name of the employee type. EXAMPLE Employed, retired, probation and part-time.

Name: Department Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Department. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: The code of department rosters. EXAMPLE The IT department is designated as code 0018. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

Name: Employee Job Title
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Job Title. Name
Description: The title of the person in an accounting unit. EXAMPLE Accounting manager.

Name: Employee Academic Degree
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Academic Degree
Description: The highest academic degree acquired. EXAMPLE Doctor, Master.

Name: Employment Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Employment Date
Description: The employment date of the employee.

Name: Termination Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Termination Date
Description: The termination date of the employee from which the labor contract was no longer valid, or the employee no longer works in this department.

Name: User ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Employee. Associated. ADC_ User
Description: The system user ID associated with the employee. hall match the User_ID in the BAS_User table.

Name: User ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ User. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the individuals entering transactions into the accounting and/or ERP system. Typically auto-generated by the system. This field is used to join information in this table to other tables based on the fields such as Created_User_ID, Last_Modified_User_ID, Approved_User_ID and Posted_User_ID, respectively.

Name: User Active Status
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ User. Active Status. Code
Description: This indicates whether the status of the user is active or inactive. A user may become inactive due to retirement, dismissal or termination etc. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: User Status Modified Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ User. Status Modified Date
Description: The modified date of the user's activation or termination status.

Name: User Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ User. User Name
Description: The name of the user.

Name: User Job Title
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ User. User Job Title. Name
Description: The title of the person in the system. EXAMPLE System manager.

Name: Department Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ User. Department. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: The code of department rosters of the use. EXAMPLE The department name is IT department and the code is 0018. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

Name: User Role Responsibility
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ User. User Role Responsibility
Description: Free form description of the individual's functional role or primary responsibility. EXAMPLE Responsibility related to managing the information of accounts payable in the system.

Name: Customer Type ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer Type. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:identifierCode for internal # with gl-cor:identifierType = customer

Name: Customer Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer Type. Customer Type. Code
Description: The code of the customer type. EXAMPLE Using 004 to represent a Platinum customer, 005 to represent a Gold customer and 006 to represent a Silver customer. Customer_Type_Code and Customer_Type_Name are not necessarily related.

Name: Customer Type Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer Type. Customer Type. Name
Description: The name of the type categorized by the customer attributes. EXAMPLE Platinum customer, Gold customer and Silver customer.

Name: Parent Customer Type ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer Type. Parent. ADC_ Customer Type
Description: The unique identifier for the parent customer type. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Type_ID in the BAS_Customer_Type table.

Name: Customer Account ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the customer. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:identifierCode for internal # with gl-cor:identifierType = customer

Name: Customer Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Customer Account Number. Code
Description: The number of the customer. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

Name: Customer Account Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Customer Account. Name
Description: The name of the customer.

Name: Customer Abbreviation
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Abbreviation
Description: The abbreviation of the customer's name.

Name: Parent Customer ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Parent. ADC_ Customer
Description: The unique identifier for the parent customer. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

Name: Corresponding Supplier ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Corresponding. ADC_ Supplier
Description: The unique identifier for the corresponding supplier in case that the customer is also a supplier. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table. Otherwise set NULL.

Name: Customer Type ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Classified. ADC_ Customer Type
Description: The unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Type_ID in the BAS_Customer_Type table.

Name: Customer TIN
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Tax Identification Number. Code
Description: The customer's tax identification number. This number is usually generated by tax regulator.

Name: Customer Physical Address
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Address. Physical_ Address
Description: The customer's physical address.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Customer Billing Address
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Address. Billing_ Address
Description: The customer's billing address.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Primary Contact Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Crresponding. ADC_ Primary Contact
Description: The name of the primary contact for the customer.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Inactive Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Inactive. Date
Description: The date that the customer was declared inactive. For example a customer may become inactive due to exceeding credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy etc.

Name: Transaction Credit Limit
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Transaction Credit Limit. Amount
Description: The per invoice credit limit established for the customer.

Name: Total Credit Limit
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Total Credit Limit. Amount
Description: The credit limit for the customer's total outstanding balance.

Name: Terms Discount Percentage
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Terms Discount. Percentage
Description: The discount percentage the customer can take if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to decimal place. EXAMPLE 10% would be represented as 0.10.

Name: Terms Discount Days
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Terms Discount Days. Numeric
Description: The number of days from the invoice date the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places. EXAMPLE 10 days would be represented as 10.

Name: Terms Due Days
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Terms Due Days. Numeric
Description: The default number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
XBRLGL: See description for field; explicit in gl-cor:maturityDate

Name: Activity Records
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customer. Recorded. ADC_ Activity Records
Description: The activity records on this data entry.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Supplier Type ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier Type. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Supplier Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier Type. Code
Description: The code of the supplier type. EXAMPLE Using 004 to represent preferred suppliers, 005 to represent key suppliers, and 006 to represent common suppliers.

Name: Supplier Type Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier Type. Name
Description: The name of the type categorized by the supplier attributes. EXAMPLE Preferred supplier, key supplier and common supplier.

Name: Parent Supplier Type ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier Type. Parent. ADC_ Supplier Type
Description: The unique identifier for the parent supplier type. EXAMPLE Raw material supplier is a parent type of iron supplier. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID in the BAS_Supplier_Type table.

Name: Supplier Account ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:identifierCode for internal # with gl-cor:identifierType = vendor

Name: Supplier Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Account Number. Code
Description: The number of the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied. The number is usually generated by manual input or generated by the system.

Name: Supplier Account Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Account Name
Description: The name of the supplier.

Name: Supplier Abbreviation
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Abbreviation
Description: The abbreviation of the supplier's name.

Name: Parent Supplier ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Parent. ADC_ Supplier
Description: The unique identifier for the parent supplier. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

Name: Corresponding Customer ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Corresponding. ADC_ Customer
Description: The unique identifier for the corresponding customer in case that the supplier is also a customer. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table. Otherwise set NULL.

Name: Supplier Type ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. classified. ADC_ Supplier Type
Description: The unique identifier for the supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Type_ID in the BAS_Supplier_Type table.

Name: Supplier TIN
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Tax Identification Number. Code
Description: The supplier's tax identification number. The number is usually generated by the tax regulator.

Name: Supplier Physical Address
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Address. Physical_ Address
Description: The supplier's physical address.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Supplier Billing Address
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Address. Billing_ Address
Description: The supplier's billing address.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Primary Contact Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Corresponding. ADC_ Primary Contact
Description: The name of the primary contact for the supplier.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Supplier Group
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Group. Code
Description: Supplier group assignments when the organization segments the suppliers.

Name: Inactive Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Inactive. Date
Description: The date the supplier was declared inactive. For example a supplier may become inactive due to exceeding credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy etc.

Name: Transaction Credit Limit
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Transaction Credit Limit. Amount
Description: The per invoice credit limit established for this supplier.

Name: Total Credit Limit
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Total Credit Limit. Amount
Description: The credit limit for the total outstanding balance approved for the supplier.

Name: Terms Discount Percentage
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Terms Discount. Percentage
Description: The discount percentage the supplier can provide if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to decimal place. EXAMPLE 10% would be represented as 0.10.

Name: Terms Discount Days
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Terms Discount Days. Numeric
Description: The number of days from the invoice date the supplier provides for the customer to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places. EXAMPLE 10 days would be represented as 10.

Name: Terms Due Days
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Terms Due Days. Numeric
Description: The number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
XBRLGL: See description for field; explicit in gl-cor:maturityDate

Name: Activity Records
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Supplier. Recorded. ADC_ Activity Records
Description: The activity records on this data entry.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: GL Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. ID
Description: The GL account number.

Name: GL Account Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. GL Account. Name
Description: The name of the GL account.

Name: GL Account Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. Description
Description: The label or description associated with the GL_Account_Number.

Name: FS Caption
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. Caption
Description: The financial statement caption represents a related group of accounts. EXAMPLE Cash and cash equivalents, accounts payable and cost of sales. The caption can be at the trial balance level.

Name: Account Type
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. Account Type. Code
Description: The type of account. EXAMPLE Assets, liabilities, equity, revenues and expenses.

Name: Account Subtype
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. Accountount Subtype. Code
Description: The subtype of the account. EXAMPLE Current assets are the subtype of assets.

Name: Account Hierarchy
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. Account Hierarchy. Numeric
Description: The corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy. EXAMPLE Using 1 to represent assets, and 2 to represent the account subtype current assets.

Name: Parent GL Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The number of the parent account in an account hierarchy. This is provided to allow more than the predefined levels of the hierarchy in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table. When Parent_GL_Account_Number is the highest level, its value can be set to the default value; for example, set to NULL. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Balance Debit Or Credit
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. Debit Or Credit. indicator
Description: This field is used to indicate whether the natural balance of the account is a debit or credit balance by indicating D or C, where assets and expenses have a natural balance of debit, and liabilities, equity and revenues have a natural balance of credit.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the GL account is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Chart Of Accounts. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Accounting Period ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Fiscal Period. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the accounting period.

Name: Fiscal Year
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Fiscal Period. Fiscal Year. Code
Description: The fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYYMM-DD in ISO 8601-1.

Name: Accounting Period
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Fiscal Period. Period. Code
Description: The accounting period in which the calendar date occurs. EXAMPLE W1_W53 for weekly periods, M1_M12 for monthly periods, Q1_Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date.

Name: Begining Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Fiscal Period. Beginning. Date
Description: The calendar beginning date of the current accounting period.

Name: Ending Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Fiscal Period. Ending. Date
Description: The calendar ending date of the current accounting period.

Name: Journal Entry Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Journal Entry Type. ID
Description: The code of the journal entry type. EXAMPLE Using 004 to represent a cash receipt entry, 005 to represent a cash disbursement entry, and 006 to represent a non-cash entry.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Journal Entry Type Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Journal Entry Type. JE Type. Name
Description: The name of the journal entry type. This is usually categorized by business to satisfy an internal control need and/or to facilitate sorting and querying; for example, journal entries could be classified based on whether the transaction involves cash. In this case there may be cash receipt entry, cash disbursement entry, and non-cash entry of adjusting that is the recording of interest revenue earned and wages payable, estimation that is the recording depreciation, and bad-debt expenses, and/or correction that makes entries to counteract the effects of errors found in the general ledger.

Name: Journal Entry Type Abbreviation
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Journal Entry Type. Abbreviation
Description: The abbreviation of the journal entry type.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Journal Entry Type. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the JE type is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Bill Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bill Type. ID
Description: The code of the bill type. EXAMPLE Using 004 to represent bank draft, 005 to represent promissory note, and 006 to represent check.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Bill Type Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bill Type. Bill Type Name
Description: The name of the bill type. EXAMPLE Bank draft, commercial draft, promissory note and check.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bill Type. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the bill type is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Settlement Method Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Settlement Method. ID
Description: The code of the settlement method. Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money; for example, 001 for cash, 002 for bills, 003 for credit card, 004 for remittance, and 005 for bank collection.

Name: Settlement Method Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Settlement Method. Settlement Method. Name
Description: The name of the settlement method. EXAMPLE Cash settlement, issuing bills, credit card, bank remittance and bank collection.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Settlement Method. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the settlement method is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Currency Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Currency. ID
Description: The code of the currency (ISO 4217).

Name: Currency Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Currency. Currency. Name
Description: The name of the currency in the accounting and/or ERP system.

Name: Minor Unit
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Currency. Minor Unit. Numeric
Description: The unit of recorded value which is a division of the respective unit of currency. Minor unit shows the decimal relationship between such unit and the currency itself (ISO 4217). Number 0 means that there is no minor unit for that currency, whereas number 1, 2, 3, etc. signify a ratio of 10:1, 100:1, 1 000:1, etc. respectively. EXAMPLE The US cent is a one hundredth part of the US dollar; the GB penny is a one hundredth part of the pound sterling. The minor unit number for both is 2.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Currency. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether Currency_Code is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: UOM Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Measurement Unit. ID
Description: The code of the measurement unit.

Name: UOM Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Measurement Unit. UOM. Name
Description: The name of the measurement unit for measuring the quantity of the material, etc.

Name: UOM Abbreviation
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Measurement Unit. Abbreviation
Description: The abbreviation of the measurement unit's name. EXAMPLE Kilogram is recorded as kg and square meter is recorded as sq.m.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Measurement Unit. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the UOM_Code is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Payment Term Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Payment Term. ID
Description: The code of the payment term. EXAMPLE Terms of 2/10, net 60 could be quoted. This means that customers have 60 days from the invoice date to pay the full amount. However, if payment is made within 10 days, a 2 percent cash discount can be taken.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Payment Term Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Payment Term. Payment Term. Name
Description: The full name of the payment term.

Name: Payment Term Line Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Payment Term. Line Number. Code
Description: The number of the lines according to the Payment_Term_Code value. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Payment Term Line Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Payment Term. Description
Description: The detailed description of the payment term's line. EXAMPLE Payment due date, discount days, and discount percentage.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Payment Term. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the payment term is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Project ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Project. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Project Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Project. Project. Code
Description: The code of the project.

Name: Project Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Project. Project. Name
Description: The name of the project related to operation and administration.

Name: Project Beginning Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Project. Beginning. Date
Description: The beginning date of the project.

Name: Project Ending Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Project. Ending. Date
Description: The ending date of the project.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Project. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the project is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Project. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Bank Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. ID
Description: The number of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center. ISO 13616 is recommended if applicable.

Name: Bank Account Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Bank Account. Name
Description: The name of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.

Name: Bank Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Bank Code
Description: The code of the financial institution (ISO 9362 or ISO 17442). ISO 17442 is preferred. One reason is that bank branch identifier will not change due to location movement.

Name: Bank Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Bank Name
Description: The full name of the institution, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.

Name: Branch Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Branch Code
Description: The code of the institution's branch.

Name: Branch Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Branch Name
Description: The full name of the institution's branch.

Name: Branch Country
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Physical_ Country. Code
Description: The country code where the branch is physically located (ISO 3166-1).

Name: Branch Region
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Branch Region
Description: Sub-region within country; in the U.S., this would be a state; in Canada it would be a province.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the bank account is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Bank Account. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Regulator Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. ID
Description: The code of the regulator or jurisdiction.

Name: Regulator Country
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Physical_ Country. Code
Description: The country code where the regulator is located (ISO 3166-1).

Name: Regulator Region
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Regulator Region
Description: The sub-region within a country. EXAMPLE In the U.S. this would be a state and in Canada this would be a province.

Name: Regulator Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Regulator Name
Description: The name of the regulator for which tax is withheld or accrued.

Name: Regulator Role
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Regulator Role. Code
Description: The role of the regulator: federal, regional or local.

Name: Regulator Payable Account NUM
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Payable _ GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The GL account used to reflect amounts payable to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Regulator Accrual Account NUM
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Accrual_ GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The GL account used to reflect accruals due to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Regulator Expense Account NUM
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Expense_ GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The GL account used to reflect expense related to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Regulator ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. ID
Description: The ID assigned/generated by the regulator for the reporting organization to the regulator.

Name: Regulator Reporting ORG
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Regulator Reporting. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: The code of the reporting organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

Name: Regulator Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the Regulator_Code is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Regulatory. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Tax Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Type. ID
Description: A code used to refer to this tax type, used as a key or cross-reference in files. EXAMPLE Using 004 to represent the income tax, 005 to represent the tariff, and 006 to represent the value added tax.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Tax Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Type. Tax. Name
Description: The name of the tax type. EXAMPLE Income tax, Tariff and Value added tax.

Name: Regulator Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Type. Regulator. ADC_ Tax Regulatory
Description: The code of the regulator for this tax. Shall match the Regulator_Code in the BAS_Tax_Regulatory table.

Name: Tax Type Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Type. Description
Description: The description of the tax type.

Name: Tax Code Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Type. Description
Description: The description of the tax code, subdivision of the tax type. EXAMPLE Lower percentage applicable for common goods.

Name: Tax Percentage
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Type. Tax. Percentage
Description: Default percentage for this combination of tax type and tax code. Can as of the Extracted_Date from Profile table.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Tax Type. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Customized ACC Segment Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Segment. ID
Description: The code of customized account segment which audit data needs to be used; this does not include the fixed account segment having been identified; for example, unlike customer, budget information is not included in the Base module as an individual table, therefore budget can be identified as a customized account segment.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Customized ACC Segment Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Segment. Customized Account Segment Name
Description: The customized account segment name which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget records planned revenue and expenditure.

Name: Customized ACC Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Segment. Description
Description: The customized account segment description which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget can be described as the annual plan of aggregated fiscal revenue and expenditure for a state, which is verified and approved through legal procedures.

Name: Customized ACC Encoding Rule
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Segment. Encoding Rule. Code
Description: The encoding rules of the value of a customized account segment. If the encoding rule has a hierarchy feature, each level is separated by -; for example, budget (with 1-digit code, like 1) can be subdivided into financial budget (with 2-digit code, like 01) and construction budget (with 2-digit code, like 05), with the financial budget containing budgeted revenue (with 2-digit code, like 03) and budgeted expenditure (with 2-digit code, like 04), which are the thirdlevel segments. In this case, Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2.

Name: Hierarchy Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Segment. Hierarchy Flag. Indicator
Description: Whether the table value has a hierarchy feature or not. EXAMPLE 1 means yes and 0 means no.

Name: Active Flag
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Segment. Active Flag. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code is active or inactive. EXAMPLE 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

Name: Customized ACC Value Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Value. ID
Description: The code of the customized account segment value. If the Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2, the corresponding budgetfinancial budget-budgeted expenditure is 10104.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Customized ACC Segment Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Value. Associated. ADC_ Customized Account Segment
Description: This field is associated with the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment table. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment table.

Name: Customized ACC Value Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Value. Customized Account Value Name
Description: The name of the account segment value of each file. EXAMPLE budget-financial budgetbudgeted expenditure.

Name: ACC Value Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Value. Description
Description: The detailed description of the account segment value.

Name: Parent ACC Value Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Value. Parent. ADC_ Customized Account Value
Description: The code of the parent customized account segment value. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Value_Code in BAS_Customized_ACC_Value table.

Name: Customized ACC Value Hierarchy
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Customized Account Value. Customized Account Value Hierarchy
Description: The level of the current value in the file structure. EXAMPLE 1 means the highest.

Name: Profile Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. ID
Description: The number of the current data collection. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Profile Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Profile. Name
Description: The name of the current data collection.

Name: Fiscal Period
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Defined. ADC_ Fiscal Period
Description: Accounting period in which the calendar date occurs. The date shall be shown as YYYY-MM-DD in the extended format and the YYYY indicates a fourdigit year (ISO 8601-1).

Name: Accounting Entity
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Accounting Entity. Name
Description: The legal name of accounting entity.

Name: Industry
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Industry
Description: The corresponding industry name under superior sector code.

Name: Developer Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Developer. Name
Description: The name of accounting and/or ERP system software developer.

Name: Software Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Software. Name
Description: The name of accounting and/or ERP system software products.

Name: Software Version
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Software Version
Description: The accounting and/or ERP system software version.

Name: Functional Currency Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Functional_ Currency. ADC_ Currency
Description: The functional or group currency used in accounting and/or ERP system software (ISO 4217).

Name: Standard Version
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Standard Version
Description: The standard issuing No. of the standards with which the current output files are consistent. EXAMPLE ISO 21378.

Name: Extracted Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Extracted. Date
Description: The date of data extraction.

Name: Time Zone
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. Time Zone. Code
Description: The Time_Zone indicates the difference between local time and UTC of day. The representation of the difference can be expressed in hours and minutes, or hours only. The Time_Zone shall be shown as + - hh:mm in the extended format (ISO 8601-1). EXAMPLE Newfoundland's time zone =-03:30, Beijing's time zone=+08:00.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Profile. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Trial Balance. ID
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: GL Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Trial Balance. GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The GL account number. The number is often generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Fiscal Period
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Trial Balance. Defined. ADC_ Fiscal Period
Description: Accounting period in which the Balance_As_Of_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Name: Balance As Of Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Trial Balance. Balance As Of Date
Description: The date through which the provided balance reflects account activity. EXAMPLE If a report was run for activity through 20141231 on 20150122, the date recorded would be 20141231.
XBRLGL: A common end-of date is noted by gl-cor:periodCoveredEnd; mixed period end dates could be noted by gl-cor:postingDate

Name: Beginning Multicurrrency Amount
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Trial Balance. Beginning_ Balance. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: Beginning balance amount of the period (same amount as the ending balance from the prior period)
XBRLGL: XBRL GL does not have separate beginning and ending amounts on a line. This would use a second line, with optional gl-cor:xbrlInclude = beginning_balance and gl-cor:periodCoveredStart

Name: Ending Multicurrrency Amount
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Trial Balance. Ending_ Balance. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: Ending balance amount for the period.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Trial Balance. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Journal ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:entryNumber and gl-cor:lineNumber / Rather than using data fields, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Journal Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Entry_ Number. Code
Description: The number of the journal entry; for example, including serial number, document type, and date.

Name: GL Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The GL account number. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Fiscal Period
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Defined. ADC_ Fiscal Period
Description: Accounting period in which the Effective_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Name: Effective Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Effective. Date
Description: The date of the journal entry, no matter when the entry is received or created. This sometimes refers to the accounting date or accounting effective date; for example, if the user wants to see the financial results for the period ending March 5, 20X1, the journal entry may be created on any day during the open period and be assigned to the period ending March 5, 20X1.

Name: Journal Line Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Line_ Number. Code
Description: The number of the line within a journal entry. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

Name: JE Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Journal Entry Type. ADC_ Journal Entry Type
Description: The code of journal entry type. Shall match the JE_Type_Code in the BAS_Journal_Entry_Type table.

Name: JE Header Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Entry_ Description
Description: Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.

Name: JE Line Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Line_ Description
Description: Description of the individual line within the journal entry.

Name: Source Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Originating. ADC_ General Ledger Source
Description: Code for source from which the journal entry originated. EXAMPLE Sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, or spreadsheet. Shall match the Source_Code in the GL_Source table.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:sourceJournalID if an enumerated set is feasible; gl-cor:sourceJournalDescription otherwise.

Name: Bill Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Bill Number. Code
Description: The number of the bill. A bill usually includes bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. A bill may be issued by the drawer who agreed upon themselves or entrust the drawee at sight; a specified date to the payee or bearer unconditionally pays a certain amount of securities. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

Name: Bill Type Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Related. ADC_ Bill Type
Description: The type of the bill. EXAMPLE Bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. Shall match the Bill_Type_Code in the BAS_Bill_Type table.

Name: Bill Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Bill Date
Description: The date of the bill.

Name: Quantity
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Quantity. ADC_ Measurement Quantity
Description: The quantity of items referenced in the journal entry line. When the GL_Account_Number is for inventories or fixed assets, this field is effective, if not, this field is NULL.

Name: Unit Price
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Unit Price. Amount
Description: The per unit price of the inventory or PPE. This field is associated with Quantity and Amount; for example, if the account is inventory or PPE, we can multiply Quantity by Unit_Price to get total line Amount.

Name: Multicurrrency Amount
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Monetary Amount. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: Monetary amount recorded in the multi currency.

Name: Settlement Method Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Settlement Method. ADC_ Settlement Method
Description: The code value or indicator of the settlement method used for cash receipt from customers (i.e. sales) and cash payment to suppliers (i.e. purchase); for example, check, wire transfer and cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

Name: Credit Debit Indicator
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Credit Debit. Indicator
Description: This indicates whether the amount is a credit or a debit. EXAMPLE C=credit; D=debit.

Name: Reversal Indicator
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Reversal. Indicator
Description: Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed. EXAMPLE 1 = entry is a reversal, 2 = entry is being reversed, and empty () = none of the above or system generated indicators.
XBRLGL: gl-usk:reverse true = entry is to be reversed false with gl-usk:reversingDate = provided = entry is a reversal not provided = none of the above.

Name: Reversal Journal ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Reversal. ADC_ General Ledger Line
Description: When the Reversal_Indicator = 1, this field identifies the Journal_ID of the entry being reversed.

Name: Cancellation Sign
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Cancellation Sign. Indicator
Description: The sign of cancellation of a journal entry already formed but not yet posted. EXAMPLE 0=entry is not cancelled; 1=entry is cancelled.

Name: Activity Records
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Recorded. ADC_ Activity Records
Description: The operation records on this record such as create, approve, last modify this record.
XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

Name: Posted User ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Posted By. ADC_ User
Description: The unique identifier for the person who posted the journal entry to ledger. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID in the BAS_User table.

Name: Account Segment Employee
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Related. ADC_ Employee
Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to an employee (e.g. loan to corporate officers). The value stored in this field stored is Employee_ID. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table through GL_Account_Segment.

Name: Account Segment Project
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Related. ADC_ Project
Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to a project. EXAMPLE Construction projects which require a separate accounting. The value of this field stored is Project_ID. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table through GL_Account_Segment.

Name: Account Segment Bank Account
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Related. ADC_ Bank Account
Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to bank accounts. The value of this field stored is Bank_Account_Number, and we can get more information of a certain bank account in the BAS_Bank_Account table. Shall match the Bank_Account_Number in the BAS_Bank_Account table through GL_Account_Segment.

Name: Account Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. Account Segment X. Identifier
Description: Reserved field that shall be used for supplementary information associated with particular account. The 'X' signifies that each unique account segment will be captured in a separate field.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Line. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Source Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Source. ID
Description: The code of the posting source (code for source from which the journal entry originated. EXAMPLE Sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry and spreadsheet). The code shall be a unique indicator for the underlying source.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:sourceJournalID if an enumerated set is feasible; gl-cor:sourceJournalDescription otherwise.

Name: Source Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Source. Description
Description: A description of the source system.
XBRLGL: gl-bus:batchDescription if gl-cor:sourceJournalDescription is used above.

Name: ERP Subledger Module
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Source. ERP Subledger Module. Code
Description: Description of the subledger or ERP module from which the journal entry originated. Should tie back to a system or significant accounting process. In some instances, can be represented by the source system.

Name: System Manual Identifier
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Source. System Manual. Identifier
Description: This indicates whether the journal entry is system-generated (S) or manually-entered (M). EXAMPLE S is system-generated and M is manually-entered.

Name: Business Process Major
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Source. Business Process Major. Code
Description: The major class of transaction associated with a business process. EXAMPLE Sales.

Name: Business Process Minor
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Source. Business Process Minor. Code
Description: A sub-process of the major business process. EXAMPLE Orders, returns, and discounts.

Name: GL Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Segment. GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The GL account number. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Account Segment Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Segment. ID
Description: The number of the Account_Segment. Case 1 If the value of this field is 0, the record is used to explain a fixed account segment that is distinguished by Account_Segment_Name of the record. Case 2 If the value of this field is 5, the record is used to explain the No.5 field of Account_Segment_X, named Account_Segment_5 in the tables, such as GL_Details. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Account Segment Name
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Segment. Account Segment. Name
Description: The name of the Account_Segment. Case 1 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 0, the field contains the name of a fixed account segment, such as Account_Segment_Employee. Case 2 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 5, the field value should be the name of a customized account segment, like welfare expenditure.

Name: Corresponding File
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Segment. Corresponding File
Description: The table corresponding to account segment. Case 1 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 0, the field contains the table name corresponding to the fixed account segment, such as BAS_Employee for Account_Segment_Employee. Case 2 If the value of Account_Segment_Number is larger than 0, and no other table besides BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment. Case 3 If the value of Account_Segment_Number is larger than 0, and there is a table contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be the table's name, such as BAS_Customer.

Name: Account Segment Description
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Segment. Description
Description: The detailed description of the Account_Segment_Name.

Name: Customized ACC Segment Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Segment. Related. ADC_ Customized Account Segment
Description: The code of the customized account segment. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment table.

Name: GL Account Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
Description: The GL account number. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

Name: Fiscal Period
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Defined. ADC_ Fiscal Period
Description: Accounting period in which the Effective_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Name: Debit Quantity
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Debit. ADC_ Measurement Quantity
Description: The quantity information associated with debiting inventory or PPE.

Name: Credit Quantity
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Credit. ADC_ Measurement Quantity
Description: The quantity information associated with crediting inventory or PPE.

Name: Beginning Quantity
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Beginning. ADC_ Measurement Quantity
Description: The beginning quantity of inventory or PPE account.

Name: Ending Quantity
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Ending. ADC_ Measurement Quantity
Description: The ending quantity of inventory or PPE account.

Name: Multicurrency Debit Amount
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Debit. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: The cumulative debit total of multi currency during the Accounting_Period.

Name: Multicurrency Credit Amount
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Credit. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: The cumulative credit total amount of multi currency during the Accounting_Period.

Name: BEG Balance Indicator
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Beginning Balance. Indicator
Description: The beginning balance direction for the account. This indicates whether beginning balance is debit or credit. EXAMPLE C=credit; D=debit.

Name: Ending Balance Indicator
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Ending Balance. Indicator
Description: The ending balance direction for the account. This indicates whether ending balance is debit or credit. EXAMPLE C=credit; D=debit.

Name: Multicurrency Beginning Balance
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Beginning_ Balance. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: The beginning balance of multi currency.

Name: Multicurrency Ending Balance
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Ending_ Balance. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: The ending balance of multi currency.

Name: Account Segment Employee
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Related. ADC_ Employee
Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to an employee (e.g. loan to corporate officers). The value stored in this field stored is Employee_ID. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table through GL_Account_Segment.

Name: Account Segment Project
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Related. ADC_ Project
Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to a project; for example, construction projects which require a separate accounting. The value of this field stored is Project_ID. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table through GL_Account_Segment.

Name: Account Segment Bank Account
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Related. ADC_ Bank Account
Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to bank accounts. The value of this field stored is Bank_Account_Number, and we can get more information of a certain bank account in the BAS_Bank_Account table. Shall match the Bank_Account_Number in the BAS_Bank_Account table through GL_Account_Segment.

Name: Account Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. Account Segment X. Identifier
Description: Reserved field that shall be used for supplementary information associated with particular account. The 'X' signifies that each unique account segment will be captured in a separate field.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ General Ledger Account Period Balance. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Transaction ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the transaction of an open AR includes invoice and cash received. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Invoice ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Originating. ADC_ Invoice Generated
Description: The unique identifier for the invoice, from which AR is derived. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if adjustment is at customer (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID in the SAL_Invoices_Generated table.

Name: Customer Account ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Payer. ADC_ Customer
Description: The unique identifier for the customer payment is expected or to whom unused credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

Name: Sales Contract ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Originating. ADC_ Sales Contract
Description: The unique identifier for the sales contract, from which AR is derived. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if no transaction related to Sales_Contract_ID. Otherwise shall match the Sales_Contract_ID in the SAL_Contracts table.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference  / Rather than use a data field, use XML's ID and IDREF to create the physical link from detail to summary structure.

Name: Project ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Originating. ADC_ Project
Description: The unique identifier for the project, from which AR is derived. Typically auto-generated by the system. If no transaction related to Project_ID, may be set to NULL. Otherwise shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table.

Name: Fiscal Period
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Defined. ADC_ Fiscal Period
Description: Accounting period in which the Transaction_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Name: Transaction Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Transaction. Date
Description: The date of the transaction, regardless of the date the transaction is created. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.

Name: Journal ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Corresponding. ADC_ General Ledger Line
Description: The unique identifier for the journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Journal_ID in the GL_Details table.
XBRLGL: Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Transaction Due Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Transaction Due. Date
Description: The date payment is due from the customer. Not all transactions will have a due date. May be set to NULL, if there is no due date. EXAMPLE Credit memos. Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.

Name: Reference Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Reference Number. Code
Description: The number of an internally or externally generated transaction; for example, check number, wire transfer number, or original document ID.

Name: Reference Date
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Reference Date
Description: The date on an internally or externally generated transaction; for example, check date or wire transfer date.

Name: Multicurrrency Amount
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Monetary Amount. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the multi currency.

Name: Multicurrency Balance
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Balance. ADC_ Multi Currency Amount
Description: Balance monetary amount recorded in the multi currency. The balance here refers to the remaining balance unreceived or needing settlement, which can be calculated by analyzing net of the originating invoice and any cash received and adjustments against it.

Name: Remark
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Remark
Description: Freeform text description.

Name: Grouping Code
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. Grouping. Code
Description: The code of grouping related items for different purposes.

Name: Business Segment X
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Open Accounts Receivable. X. ADC_ Business Segment
Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

Name: Receipt ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Cash Received. ID
Description: The unique identifier for the transaction of cash received. Typically auto-generated by the system.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

Name: Receipt Number
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Cash Received. Receipt Number. Code
Description: The number of the cash received, from which AR is derived. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

Name: Customer Account ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Cash Received. Payer. ADC_ Customer
Description: The unique identifier for the customer from whom payment is received or to whom credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

Name: Sales Contract ID
DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Cash Received. Originating. ADC_ Sales Contract
Description: The unique identifier for the sales contract, from which AR is derived. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL, if no transaction is related to Sales_Contract_ID. Otherwise shall match the Sales_Contract_ID in the SAL_Contracts table.
XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference  / Rather than use a data field, use XML's ID and IDREF to create the physical link from detail to summary structure.
